data.description: 2026 Summer Intern - CMG DDA - Data ScienceDepartment SummaryThe Genentech Graduate Internship Program is an intensive 10-12 week opportunity that provides work within a fast-paced and challenging environment. Interns contribute to meaningful projects, interacting and working side by side with biotech industry experts. Our internship program also provides a robust speaker series, which allows interns to hear from top executives throughout the summer. Genentech relies heavily on our internship talent pool to fill full-time positions.U.S. Commercial, Medical, and Government Affairs (CMG) Data, Digital, and Analytics (DDA)  plays a crucial role in delivering better health outcomes for patients while lowering overall health costs by partnering across the health care system. The group's primary focus is to deliver more medicines to eligible patients, faster. The development and implementation of commercial strategies involves collaboration across a variety of teams with dedicated expertise. This internship position is located in South San Francisco, CA, On-site.The OpportunityBrand-Level Knowledge Graph Development: This project will connect directly with Genentech’s commercial operations and focuses on experimenting, at a brand-level pilot scale, with advanced AI technologies to enhance Genentech’s foundational capability of knowledge creation, integration, refreshing, and consumption.High-Fidelity Medical Content Synthesis & Retrieval: This project will focus on pushing the limit of RAG for professional-level applications of LLM and other relevant Generative AI technologies in the healthcare domain.Time-Series-Based Forecasting: This project will leverage latest AI technologies to build scalable pipelines for forecasting with the capabilities of scenario simulation and planning.Program HighlightsIntensive 12-week, full-time (40 hours per week) paid internshipProgram start dates are in May/June (Summer) A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internshipOwnership of challenging and meaningful business-critical projectsDrive impact by working in a diverse global, cross-functional settingWork with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industryWho You AreMust be current enrolled in an accredited graduate program or a recent graduate of a graduate program with 2 years of work experience prior to graduate school (Graduate programs include MBA, PhD, JD, MD, MPH, MS, and Master's in Data Science)Required majorsMBA, Masters in Data Science, Masters in SciencePreferred Knowledge, Skills, and QualificationsWork experience before graduate school in consulting, finance, marketing, sales, life sciences, healthcare, consumer business, or drug developmentStrong quantitative and analytical skillsDemonstrated ability and experience in effectively interacting with executives and senior leadersDemonstrated leadership skills and experienceExcellent communication skillsRelocation benefits are not available for this job posting. The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location for this position of California is $21.00 - $55.00 per hour.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits.  #SummerAssociates2026Are you ready to apply?Genentech is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.
requirements: Must be current enrolled in an accredited graduate program or a recent graduate of a graduate program with 2 years of work experience prior to graduate school (Graduate programs include MBA, PhD, JD, MD, MPH, MS, and Master's in Data Science)
responsibilities: Brand-Level Knowledge Graph Development: This project will connect directly with Genentech’s commercial operations and focuses on experimenting, at a brand-level pilot scale, with advanced AI technologies to enhance Genentech’s foundational capability of knowledge creation, integration, refreshing, and consumption.

High-Fidelity Medical Content Synthesis & Retrieval: This project will focus on pushing the limit of RAG for professional-level applications of LLM and other relevant Generative AI technologies in the healthcare domain.
Time-Series-Based Forecasting: This project will leverage latest AI technologies to build scalable pipelines for forecasting with the capabilities of scenario simulation and planning.
A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship
Work experience before graduate school in consulting, finance, marketing, sales, life sciences, healthcare, consumer business, or drug development
